We are a product company where you as a Test Engineer will play a vital role in shaping our products from concept to completion. We set the bar high for user-friendliness and feature excellence, which makes your collaboration with customers, developers, and testers even more essential. Your contributions together with the team will help us make a real diYerence in the lives of our customers.

title: Senior Embedded Engineer
description:
Swedium Global is the growing System Engineering and Solution Company, offers services like Semiconductor Engineering R&D Services, Embedded Systems Development, Custom Application Software Development, Web and Cloud Application Development, Testing Services, Consultancy and Outsourcing services to our clients across the globe for an onsite and offshore business model. Swedium Global is having presence in Sweden, Finland, Poland, Czech Republic and in India.

Location :Gothenburg, Sweden

Expected start date : ASAP

Job Role : Senior Embedded Engineer

**Roles and Responsibility**

The role of Embedded Developer means that you will be a technical expert in your field and, through an understanding of our needs, further develop our existing product for new projects. The role includes external points of contact with both suppliers and customers, as well as internal collaboration with our various projects. You will work with hardware-near C programming of distributed safety-critical control systems and develop the future electrical drivetrains for the marine sector.

**This is you** 

We are looking for someone who finds Embedded Development to be an exciting and rewarding area of work. Since our teams work broadly with the product and focus on customer value, an interest in systems development, test development, and everything else required to bring a successful product to market is also appreciated. You stay up to date with developments in your areas of expertise and share your knowledge with others. As a person, you thrive with overall responsibility and enjoy thinking outside the box to come up with eYective and innovative solutions to the challenges you face. We are looking for someone with a very good understanding of hardware and software and the interaction between them. You should have experience in one or more of the following areas:

* Experience with Embedded Development in C
* NXP PowerPC
* Continuous integration
* FreeRTOS
* CAN
* I/O
* It is a plus if you have knowledge in:
* Automotive
* E-mobility
* Electric motor control
* Functional Safety

You can reach out to us at Pratik.pandey@swediumglobal.com or deepthi.meka@swediumglobal.com or hr@swediumglobal.com

Job Type: Full-time

Work Location: In person

* We set high standards for user-friendliness and value-added features, emphasizing close collaboration between customers, developers, and quality testing.
* You'll work alongside skilled colleagues in project teams, all dedicated to making a real impact on our customers.

**Qualifications** 

We believe you possess a curiosity about emerging products, technologies, and their practical applications. You enjoy the challenge of crafting complex systems and excel in thinking outside the box, consistently producing effective and innovative solutions for the problems you encounter.

You're good at taking a holistic view, understanding overarching requirements and potential obstacles along the path to success. Crafting and maintaining high-quality project documentation is second nature to you. You keep your finger on the pulse of developments in your specific areas of expertise and readily share the wealth of knowledge you've gained through years of experience. Juggling multiple projects simultaneously is something you thrive on, and you eagerly embrace opportunities to travel and engage directly with our customers and suppliers. In addition to your passion for system architecture, you're a good team player who enjoys creative collaboration.

**Additionally, we're seeking someone who** 

While it's a bonus with some years of experience (8+), we also value a diversity of perspectives and backgrounds. You enjoy both the thrill of high-paced work and the art of active listening. Furthermore, you are proficient in communicating eYectively in English.

title: Regional Sales Representative (RSR), Northern Europe
description:
Your Title: Regional Sales Representative (RSR), Northern Europe  

Job Location: Sweden - Danderyd or Remote: Sweden, Norway, Finland  

Division: Civil Construction Field Solutions CCFS*Are you looking to be a part of an award-winning organization and one of the fastest growing technology companies that is transforming the construction landscape with innovative technology solutions?**Join our team! We will offer your versatile tasks in a diverse, inspiring and dynamic working environment with great colleagues. Apply as soon as possible! Please, submit your CV/application only in English.*
In this position you will have a very specific focus on CEC Machine control solutions and Connected Site promotion with a primary focus on Northern Europe. You will be deeply involved in developing solid business relationships with Equipment Dealers.
What You Will Do
You will provide sales and application support for distributors and potentially end users in the CEC product portfolio You will:* Increase market share through the development of Connected Site solutions to existing accounts and new customers. You will also be able to develop customer interest on Trimble Continuum solutions to develop sales on the entire CEC solutions
* Sell through select and perhaps multiple channels of distribution and have large project involvement, and will develop strategic key end-user relationships to ensure the successful sale of all Trimble products and services. You will have a strong field presence across the Nordic region
* Be responsible for ongoing dealer development through the introduction, follow-up and ongoing involvement in Trimble’s channel development programs/workshops.


Primary Responsibilities:  

You will report to the Nordic Regional Sales Manager. Together with the Regional Sales Manager, you will participate in the development and implementation of regionally assigned sales plans. You will be in interface with distributor management, operations, sales, service and support staff.  

You will:* Develop strong long term business development with regional equipment dealers and implementation of Trimble Technology Outlets
* Conduct on site distributor training and job site demonstrations together with the application engineers
* Be in interface with major regional accounts
* Conduct joint sales presentations with focus on Educational Presentations
* Drive the Annual Review Meetings with key accounts in each dealer territory
* Assist in the identification, procurement and subsequent training of distribution sales and application personnel
* Evaluate marketplace potential for all served markets and customer segments using Data Analytics services as available
* Assist in the development of and participation in, specific technical communications and training requirements such as Trimble Dimensions, Boot Camps, Construction News, and others
* Ensure new product release involvement by all dealers including local strategy, training and proper inventory
* Provide input on competitive products and activities primarily to the CCFS Business Area
* Assist in the identification and development of new distribution.


What Skills, Experience and Knowledge You Should Bring* Proven experience of successful consultative sales
* Experience in Channel development and management
* Business, sales, market and domain knowledge in survey, civil engineering and / or construction
* Ideally experienced in Technology solutions for Construction
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills
* Ability and willingness to travel up to+/- 75%
* Proficient knowledge of civil construction applications
* Product knowledge is a bonus
* Strong collaboration and relationship building skills
* Ability to prioritize, organize and manage multiple projects at one time
* Fluency in English and one Scandinavian language. Additional Nordic language skills are a bonus.


About Our CCFS Division  

Trimble's Civil Construction Field Solutions division focuses on providing advanced technology solutions to enhance productivity, accuracy, and efficiency in civil construction projects. This division integrates hardware and software tools to support the entire construction lifecycle, from initial site assessment and planning through to design, construction, and ongoing maintenance.  

Key offerings include machine control systems, site positioning systems, and software for project management and collaboration. These tools enable precise grading, excavation, paving, and site management, which help contractors and engineers streamline workflows, reduce rework, and improve overall project outcomes. For more information on currently developed products, see https://heavyindustry.trimble.com  

About Trimble  

Dedicated to the world’s tomorrow, Trimble is a technology company delivering solutions that enable our customers to work in new ways to measure, build, grow and move goods for a better quality of life. Core technologies in positioning, modeling, connectivity and data analytics connect the digital and physical worlds to improve productivity, quality, safety, transparency and sustainability. From purpose-built products and enterprise lifecycle solutions to industry cloud services, Trimble is transforming critical industries such as construction, geospatial, agriculture and transportation to power an interconnected world of work. For more information about Trimble (NASDAQ: TRMB), visit: https://www.trimble.com/en
Trimble’s Inclusiveness Commitment  

We believe in celebrating our differences. That is why our diversity is our strength. To us, that means actively participating in opportunities to be inclusive. Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion have guided our current success while also moving our desire to improve. We actively seek to add members to our community who represent our customers and the places we live and work.  

We have programs in place to make sure our people are seen, heard, and welcomed and most importantly that they know they belong, no matter who they are or where they are coming from.
Trimble’s Privacy Policy

title: AWS Databricks Architect
description:
Cognizant is a global leader within Information Technology Services (Fortune 500 since 2011). The company was founded in 1994, and the Head Quarters is still in USA. Cognizant, which was originally Dun & Bradstreets own inhouse bureau, serves the market with vertical solutions for digital automation (cloud, AI, IoT and analytics). Cognizant operates in industries like Health Care, Life Science, Banking and Finance, Insurance, Retail, Production, Logistics, Energy etc and is a key player within the Digital revolution. Cognizant Global has a revenue of USD 17 billion and nearly 300 000 employees. To strengthen the Nordic team within Artificial Intelligence & Analytics SME Team, Cognizant is now looking to hire a: AWS/AZURE Databricks Architect – lead, Cognizant Nordics.


**Job Description**  

Are you interested in working in a global company helping market-leading clients solve strategic data and analytical challenges? Can you see yourself in a diverse environment where your daily work consists of global collaborations across industries and professions? Then you might be the one we are looking to hire for our Artificial Intelligence and Analytics Advisory SME team. At Cognizant you get the dynamic and entrepreneurial freedom of a small organization, yet the professionalism and long-term sustainability of a large organization. We are a small Nordic practice with aggressive growth ambitions. We are agile enough to engage with clients on their most strategic initiatives and have the knowhow and financial strength to deliver the most challenging change programs. “Engineering Modern business to improve everyday life “ is Cognizant’s agenda to solve business problems such as monitoring CO2 emission in logistics for sustainability, solutions for anti-money laundering in banking and Data-driven transparency in manufacturing. Our SME practice is rated leader by Forrester (AI consulting firms report).


**About the role**  

The AWS /AZURE Databricks Architect – lead role requires good skills in the development of data engineering solutions using various services required for data architecture on Databricks delta lake, streaming, AZURE, AWS, ETL Development, and data modelling. Understanding of Data Warehouse and Data Lakehouse paradigms.


**AWS/AZURE Databricks Architect – lead include:**


* Own the design and implementation of scalable and secure solutions using Databricks and AWS or AZURE


* Be responsible for the development and deployment of data pipelines and workflows to ensure efficient data processing.


* Collaborate with multi-functional teams to understand business requirements and translate them into technical solutions.


* Ensure the architecture aligns with industry standard processes and regulatory requirements.


* Implement robust security measures to protect sensitive data and ensure compliance with relevant regulations.


* Monitor system performance and implement vital adjustments to maintain optimal functionality.


* Drive continuous improvement initiatives to enhance the efficiency and effectiveness of the architecture.


* Engage with customers and principal architects understand the business requirements and build AWS or Azure cloud big data platform and solutions


**About you**  

Professionally, you have a university degree in business administration, engineering or related field. We think that you have 2-3 years’ experience in Consulting or relevant project experience with premier organization(s).


We also believe you have a strong experience in developing data lakes, and datamarts on the Databricks platform. Furthermore, strong skill sets in AWS Data Lake services such as - AWS Glue, S3 Lambda, SNS, IAM, and skills Spark, Python, and SQL. Or Microsoft Azure – Pureview and Fabric experience.


You are used to working with global and regional clients on a senior and preferably executive level. You are experienced in delivering strategy definitions and/or Artificial intelligence and analytics transformation programs across industry sectors and in different client contexts.


For this role you need to be fluent in English and one of the Nordics Languages (Swedish, Norwegian, Danish or Finnish).


Personally, you have strong interpersonal and leadership skills and an entrepreneurial mindset, as you like to creatively explore and contribute to continuous improvements. You are a doer and can proactively identify, prioritize, qualify and convert opportunities. We think that you are a genuine leader, characterized by integrity, creativity, accountability, communication and respect. We believe that hard work can go hand in hand with an informal and collaboratively work culture.


**What you can expect**


* Become part of a ‘flag ship’ success story
* Organization driven by technology – We have a tremendous technology backbone


* Open, ‘can do’ team spirit


* Environment where you can make your own ideas reality


* Drive your own career.
company_addresses: 500 Frank W. Burr Boulevard Teaneck, NJ 07666

title: FPGA Designer
description:
Qamcom is growing and we are looking for FPGA designers to join Qamcom in Lnköping!
  
  

Qamcom Research and Technology is a dynamic hub of innovation, offering specialist consulting services and product development with an emphasis on intelligent, connected systems. Our expertise spans a wide range of areas including sensors and radars, image and signal processing, embedded HW and SW, multi-modal AI analytics, and wireless communication systems, as well as application software, edge-cloud infrastructure, and functional safety.
  
Our team possesses the comprehensive skills necessary to develop complete products for serial production. We can take ownership of every aspect of the development chain from the initial design to the final product.
  
  

About the roleWe are looking for an FPGA designer who have experience from design of complete products. You will be part of a highly experienced international team and will typically work closely with our customers to identify requirements and needs, define the product’s functionality and do algorithm selection, implementation choices and life cycle considerations.
  
We work closely with our customers in an agile framework and in cross-functional teams where self-motivation as well as teamwork are essential components.
  
Who are you?
  
Minimum 6 years of experience from designing FPGA or a PhD within a suitable field
  
VHDL, Verilog and/or SystemVerilog
  
Experience of working with industrial electronics and FW for embedded systems
  
Knowledge in modern verification methodologies like constrained random- assertion- and coverage-based methodologies
  
Deep knowledge of modern FPGA technologies (e.g. AMD, Altera)
  
Fluent in English
  
Swedish work permit (or citizenship)
  
  

**Meriting qualifications for this position:**  

Knowledge about testing, both in production and during development
  
Knowledge of implementing Signal Processing application in RTL
  
Experience in creating System Architectures decisions for efficient implementation.
  
Knowledge about electronics (PCBA) manufacturing and its processes
  
  

Qamcom OffersWe are proud to offer a work environment with highly competent and experienced colleagues. We create teams with a unique blend of high academic competence and rich industry experience. In our in-house projects we often create cutting-edge system solutions that encompass hardware, software, and algorithms tailored for industrial and medtech applications. Hence, we provide the possibility to apply advanced technology in various product development projects focusing on a variety of business segments like medtech, industry 4.0 and Industrial IoT and AI.
  
  

**Additionally, a sample of general benefits are listed below:**  

Competitive insurance and pension program.
  
Generous parental leave (90% of the salary).
  
Wellness policy (up to 5000 SEK/year).
  
Leasing of a bicycle and option for an employee car (electric or hybrid).
  
  

Join us at Qamcom, where your expertise will contribute to shaping the future of technology and innovation.

title: Associate Support Engineer
description:
Sinch is pioneering the way the world communicates. More than 150,000 businesses — including Google, Uber, Paypal, Visa, Tinder, and many others — rely on Sinch’s Customer Communications Cloud to power engaging customer experiences through mobile messaging, voice, and email.
  
Whether you need to verify users or craft omnichannel campaigns, Sinch makes it easy. Our AI-infused Super Network, APIs, and applications ensure you can connect with your customers reliably and securely, at every step of their journey.
  
At Sinch we “Dream Big”, “Win Together”, “Keep it simple”, and “Make it Happen”. These values are our foundation!
  
DESCRIPTION
  
We are looking for an Associate Support Engineer to join our Technical Operations Center team in Kalmar. In this role, you will focus on incident management support, ensuring smooth operations with internal systems, and providing critical support in resolving technical issues.
  
Forget about L1, L2 and L3 support - in our team, we share the full workload regardless of complexity! We handle queries from all corners of the world, and naturally, we operate 24/7 to ensure incidents are resolved quickly to minimize business disruption.
  
Collaborate with internal teams to ensure smooth resolution of issues.
  
Conduct in-depth troubleshooting at both the software and network layers to identify and resolve technical problems.
  
Acting as Incident Manager for our core services, ensuring timely resolutions and minimizing system downtime.
  
Monitor internal alerts and ensure incidents are managed and escalated as needed.
  
Document and track alerts and incidents for future improvements.
  
Using insights from resolved incidents to drive ongoing system improvements and optimization.
  
  

REQUIREMENTS
  
Sinch is a tech company through and through where great ideas are listened to and often implemented - we want you to feel part of the bigger picture!
  
This role is full of challenges and offers plenty of opportunities to grow. To thrive here, you’ll need a curious mindset and a passion for learning. A “can-do” attitude will help you turn obstacles into opportunities and keep you moving forward.
  
Onsite role in Kalmar, Sweden.
  
Willingness to work in 24/7 shift rotation.
  
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or experience in related field.
  
  

Big plus!
  
  

**To stand out from the crowd, you have:**  

Hands-on experience with incident management and platform monitoring.
  
Understanding of the TCP/IP protocol suite.
  
Experience collaborating effectively with internal teams and stakeholders, demonstrating accountability and the ability to take ownership of issues.
  
Knowledge with UNIX and Linux systems.
  
Background in telecoms and wireless communication.
  
Understanding of mobile communications standards like GSM and 4G.
  
Knowledge of the SS7 protocol suite and SIGTRAN.
  
Basic SQL skills.
  
  

Our corporate language is English, please submit your application in English.
  
OUR HIRING PROCESS
  
We are committed to ensuring a recruitment process that is fair, objective, consistent, and inclusive. Our approach includes structured, competency-based interviews designed to evaluate your skills, experience, and qualifications relevant to the role. At times, we may include a data-driven assessment to enhance our hiring success and identify candidates likely to excel.
  
We believe in a two-way process and encourage you to ask questions throughout the journey. If this role isn't what you're looking for, please explore the other opportunities listed on our career page: https://www.sinch.com/careers/.
  
No matter who you are, we hope you find an exciting path forward - hopefully with us!

title: Senior Lead Technical Consultant
description:
As Pagero’s business grows we are extending our use of our ERP system IFS Cloud.
  
We are looking for a talented software professional to be part of the ERP Team in Sweden. The team supports maintain, develop, and support an installation with over 600 uses globally.
  
  

**What you’ll need to do:**  

Gather and understand requirements and design solutions.
  
Develop new customizations.
  
Troubleshoot and correct existing customizations.
  
Contribute to upgrade related activities.
  
Integration to other business systems.
  
  

**What we are looking for:**  

Bachelor/Masters degree in Software Engineering
  
3+ years of software experience working with IFS Applications.
  
Very good knowledge of IFS development platforms and tools, preferably in IFS Cloud.
  
Excellent teamwork and communication skills.
  
Developing new features / customizations that sit seamlessly on top of IFS Applications.
  
Troubleshooting and correcting issues in IFS Applications and customizations.
  
Configurations in IFS Application 10 and Cloud.
  
Report Designer reports.
  
Experience in IFS customer implementation and upgrade projects is an advantage.
  
Strong problem solving and troubleshooting skills.
  
Strong understanding of software engineering tools and practices.
  
  

**What we offer:**  

We believe that the power of Pagero is the synergy between our people and our capabilities. We offer you the opportunity to grow your career in an inspiring and international environment.
  
  

**We also offer you:**  

A competitive monthly salary
  
30 days of vacation annually
  
Participation in Pagero’s hackathon week at an offsite location
  
An annual fitness subsidy of 2500 SEK
  
Discounts on gym memberships, massage, and a handful of yearly offers
  
Dynamic global working environment
  
A position where you can make a difference
  
  

Additional information
  
**Scope:** Full-time (6 months probationary period)
  
**Starting date:** By agreement
  
**Location:** Pagero HQ Gothenburg or Pagero Office Stockholm

title: Data Scientist
description:
In a world where product size labels are unreliable, Volumental is the footwear industry's leading FitTech company, using 3D scans and a one-of-a-kind, AI-powered recommendation engine to match everyone with the shoes that fit them best.
  
Our vision is “a world without sizes, where every body fits.” With top brand and retail partners across the world including New Balance, Fleet Feet, XXL, The Athlete’s Foot, Red Wing Shoes, Intersport and Crocs, our footprint spans 3000+ stores across 58 countries, and growing! To date, we’ve gathered more than 60 million foot scans.
  
Our online product enables e-commerce sites to help their shoppers find the best-fitting footwear through our size-guiding tool. The product has experienced rapid growth and is now being used by almost 100,000 shoppers every month. This means we have to quickly leverage data insights, both to show how we impact our customers' KPIs, as well as to learn about our end users so we can keep iterating and improving our product.
  
Who you will work with
  
We are working in cross-functional product teams with a strong product development focus. Our team values collaboration, creativity, and a passion for innovation. We have an inclusive environment where everyone's ideas are heard and respected. Every team member has strong agency and is expected to have a holistic mindset on what needs to be done. Our work environment thrives when there is open, respectful discussion and the best (data-driven) ideas win.
  
If you like being part of the early stages of product development and working alongside technically skilled and motivated colleagues, this is your opportunity.
  
What you will work on
  
Our goal is to enable shoppers to simplify their purchasing decisions online, help them find the best size, and in the end decrease fit-related returns. To measure the impact and improve our product we collect a lot of different data points, some of which are:
  
How shoppers use our product, and where they drop off, as well as ask for feedback on the experience.
  
Mobile scans and fit preferences to generate footwear recommendations.
  
Orders and returns from our customers to be able to measure the impact of the product, like conversion and return rates.
  
  

As a Data Scientist within our online product making sense of this data will be one of your primary objectives. And, in close collaboration with the Product Manager and the whole team, you will:
  
Translate data into actionable insights, for your team and our customers.
  
Promote a data-driven mindset within the team, defining priorities and guiding best practices when it comes to methodology and technology.
  
Develop dashboards and visualize key metrics to help our customers understand how we impact their business.
  
Design, conduct, and evaluate A/B tests to improve the user experience.
  
Maintain and evolve our data pipelines.
  
Tackle a variety of exciting challenges as we grow!
  
  

Some of the tools you will be using to accomplish this are BigQuery, SQL, Dataform, Python, and Amplitude. We run our products on Google Cloud Platform.
  
  

**We are excited about you because:**  

A self-motivated and collaborative team member.
  
Curious and passionate about solving challenging problems.
  
Open to teaching others and learning new things.
  
Keen to work in a caring scale-up environment.
  
  

**We expect you to:**  

Have strong collaboration skills for working with cross-functional teams.
  
Be a self-starter who can independently manage initiatives and drive them forward.
  
Have a Master’s degree in a quantitative field such as computer science, physics, statistics, or similar.
  
Be able to communicate complex insights effectively to non-technical stakeholders.
  
Be proficient in SQL and Python for data analysis.
  
  

Bonus - Not required but nice to have, absolutely let us know if you have experience with any of the following:
  
Have 2+ years of professional experience working as a data scientist/engineer.
  
You have experience with e-commerce platforms, optimizing site performance and user experience through analyzing key business metrics.
  
You have worked with data pipeline tools like Dataform, DBT, or similar.
  
You have experience working with Google Cloud Platform.
  
  

**What we can offer you:**  

Personal learning budget and access to coaching
  
Opportunity to work with a great team of 20+ nationalities in our English-speaking office
  
Occupational pension at ITP1 level
  
Flexible Public Holidays Policy
  
Options Program
  
Parental pay top-up
  
Wellness allowance
  
Dog-friendly office
  
Hybrid work policy (at least 2-3 days from our Stockholm office)
  
  

Join Volumental and be part of a team that's transforming the footwear industry with data-driven solutions. In this role, you'll have the opportunity to make a tangible impact on our product and our customers' success while growing your skills in a supportive environment.

title: Mjukvarutestare
description:
**Combitech i Stockholm** **söker****erfarna****mjukvaru****testare****so****m****vil****l** **t****a** **näs****ta****s****teg****i****ka****rriär****en.** **Vi söker** **dig** **som****har****en** **stark** **bakgrund****inom****testautomatisering****och****erfarenhet** **av** **verktyg****som****exempelvis****Selenium** **och** **Robot Framework****.****Hos** **oss****får** **du** **möjlighet****att****utveckla****och****effektivisera****testprocesser****inom****spännannde** **brancher** **såsom****försvar****, telecom** **och****fordon****.** **Om du** **är** **redo för** **en****utmaning****där** **din** **kompetens****och****ditt****engagemang****verkligen****gör****skillnad****,** **så****ser vi** **fram****emot** **din** **ansökan****.**

**Din roll som****mjukvarutestare**
-----------------------------------


Som mjukvarutestare kommer du att vara ansvarig för att utveckla och genomföra automatiserade tester för att effektivt säkerställa kvalité på utveckling och leverans. Du kommer antingen att vara på plats som konsult ute hos våra kunder eller ingå i ett av våra in-houseteam. Arbetsuppgifterna är kopplade till utveckling och underhåll av automatiserade testfall och identifiering och rapportering av buggar och problem.


Du förväntas aktivt bidra till kompetensdelning och vidareutvecklingen av kundens testmetodik och teststrategi, samt stötta i processen med att effektivisera testförmågan, både vad det gäller verktyg och kompetens. Även evaluering och implementering av testverktyg och tekniker ingår i rollen.

**Vem** **är** **du?**


Vi söker dig med en relevant högskoleutbildning eller motsvarande erfarenhet samt goda kunskaper inom IT- och nätverksteknik. Du har minst 5 års erfarenhet av mjukvarutestning och testautomatisering samt kunskap om testramverk likt Selenium, Robot Framework mfl. Du har lätt att samarbeta med utvecklare och har du bakgrund från programvaruutveckling ser vi det som extra meriterade. Vanligt förekommande programmering-och script språk är JavaScript, Java, Python eller C# och C++. Du kommer med stor sannolikhet att arbeta mot antingen cloud tjänster eller kundens egna infrastruktur och implementera automatiserade tester i deras CI/CD flöde,, varför erfarenhet av detta är ett krav.

  

Tjänsten som testare ställer höga krav på integritet, omdöme samt att kunna arbeta strukturerat. Du måste därför vara bra på att planera och organisera ditt arbete, samt ha förmågan och viljan att aktivt utveckla verksamheten. Att leverera med kvalitet och i tid är en självklarhet. Utöver detta är problemlösningsförmåga viktigt samt en flexibilitet i att både kunna arbeta självständigt och i team.


Du är engagerad i det du gör och har förmågan att själv se vad som behöver göras för att därefter realisera det, du förblir lugn och klarar av att prioritera rätt även när belastningen är hög. Du har lätt för att samarbeta med kollegor och andra intressenter.

**Då****tjänsten****innebär****arbete****som****omfattas** **av** **försvarssekretess****krävs** **det** **att** **du** **genomför****och****godkänns****i****en****säkerhetsprövning** **med** **registerkontroll****.**

**Urval** **sker****löpande pga julledighet****. Vi ser** **fram****emot** **din** **ansökan****!**

**Kom & gör****skillnad**
-------------------------


Vi arbetar främst med kunder inom försvarssektorn och industrin. Vi vill ständigt öka vår förmåga att möta och överträffa de krav som ställs i ett osäkert omvärldsläge. Vi är specialister på våra kunders unika behov och vi accelererar kundens utveckling genom att skapa team med rätt kompetens, tydligt driv och en passion för uppdraget. Hos oss får du vara med och utveckla ditt ledarskap för att möta kraven i framtidens samhälle.


Vårt kompetensutvecklingsprogram Combitech GROW ingår som en naturlig del i din anställning. Vi ger dig möjlighet att växa i en företagskultur som uppmuntrar till såväl personlig som professionell utveckling, samtidigt som du arbetar i spännande och givande uppdrag.

**Vill du veta mer om hur det är att arbeta hos oss? Kolla in** våra karriärsidor på vår webb!

**Kontakt/****rekryterande****chef****:** Petra Charlotte Arrenäs, petracharlotte.arrenas@combitech.com

title: Power BI Data Analyst
description:
**Techster Solutions** befinner i dagsläget sig i en spännande tillväxtfas och söker nu fler kollegor, inledningsvis dig med minst **4+** års erfarenhet och som kan stärka teamet.

  

Du kan förvänta dig en omväxlande miljö, dagarna kan se väldigt olika ut - men en sak är säkert, här får du använda dina kompetenser och sätter själv gränsen för hur mycket du vill utvecklas. Som ett kunskapsbolag är det viktigt för oss att våra specialister delar med sig av sin kompetens och får kollegorna att växa.

  

Rollbeskrivning:

**Assignment**  

We are seeking a skilled Power BI Data Analyst to support our organization in developing tools and dashboards for data visualization and reporting. The consultant will:  

* Design and implement interactive Power BI dashboards and reports tailored to business


needs.  

* Extract, transform, and analyze data from various sources.
* Collaborate with stakeholders to understand requirements and translate them into


actionable insights.  

* Ensure scalability, usability, and performance optimization of Power BI solutions.
* Provide training or documentation to enable internal teams to use Power BI efficiently.

  

**Where will the assignment be performed (Onsite, Hybrid, offsite)**  

Hybrid 50% office and 50% onsite in Södertälje.
  

  

**Education**  

* Bachelor’s degree or higher in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, Business


Intelligence, or a related field.  

* Certifications in Power BI or similar data visualization tools are highly desirable.

  

**Language**  

* Proficiency in Swedish and English, both written and spoken.
* Experience with DAX (Data Analysis Expressions) and Power Query (M) is required.
* Familiarity with programming languages such as Python, R, or SQL is a plus.

  

**Meriting**  

* Previous experience as a Data Analyst or similar role focusing on Power BI


development.  

* Knowledge of advanced analytics, predictive modeling, or machine learning


integration with Power BI.  

* Experience in working with cloud platforms such as Azure or AWS.
* Strong understanding of database systems and ETL processes.
**Ansökan**  

Tror du att du är **Techster Solutions** nästa stjärna? Tveka då inte att skicka in din ansökan redan nu. Urval sker löpande och tillträde sker enligt överenskommelse.

**Arbetsplats och kultur**
--------------------------


Vi är ett entreprenördrivet IT företag, med både produktkunskap och försäljning (Techster AB) och konsultativa tjänster (Techster Solutions AB). Det innebär att vi är mycket öppna för nya tekniska lösningar, kunskapsutbyte och ständigt lärande. Att ha roligt och samtidigt behålla den familjära andan utan hierarkier är lika viktigt.


Vi vill skapa det konsultbolag som du alltid velat jobba för, men kanske inte hittat ännu. Redan idag har vi en blandning av seniora och yngre medarbetare, såväl som män och kvinnor. Det vill vi fortsätta att bygga på. Så välkommen med din ansökan!

title: Sr Full Stack Engineer
description:
**Description**

*Join us at Palm, a well-funded, early-stage fintech startup, on a mission to guide the world’s money flows. As part of our founding team of treasurers, finance specialists, and engineers, you'll help build a world-class treasury management system for enterprises.*

*Are you looking for an impactful job where you can contribute to every single part of the product and company culture? Are you based in Amsterdam or Stockholm and open to mostly remote work? We want to hear from you!*

**About Palm engineering**


Engineering at Palm today consists of a team of seven engineers with diverse engineering and cultural backgrounds. We are located in Amsterdam and Stockholm, mostly working remotely with frequent gatherings in one of our locations or at off-sites where it is warmer and sunnier ️


The engineering team has been working together since November 2023 so there is still a lot of opportunities for high impact work as well as playing an important role in further shaping the engineering organisation and culture.


Engineering at Palm is defined by our principles:



* **Bias to Action:** In the face of uncertainty, we prototype fast and often.


* **Open Communication:** We courageously voice concerns to realign our direction as needed.


* **Passion for Challenges:** We love the problem and embrace challenges.



In order to achieve this we lean on a culture of collaboration and knowledge sharing, where curiosity, respect and openness are some of our guiding principles. We truly value diversity and are happy to have our perspectives challenged. And of course, let’s have fun together!

**Our tool/tech stack**

* **Backend (Web App):** Golang, GraphQL
* **Frontend:** TypeScript, React, GraphQL/Apollo
* **Data Pipelines:** Python, BigQuery, Airflow
* **ML/AI:** We leverage various AI and ML technologies, such as LLMs and forecasting models
* **Database:** PostgreSQL
* **Cloud:** GCP
* **Version Control:** Git
* We are continuously iterating and exploring technologies as we go - so there’s more to come!

**How will you make an impact?**

* Design, prototype, build and own product features
* Build the backend / frontend for our data-intensive web app
* Improve reliability, observability and performance of everything mentioned above
* Write unit and integrations tests
* Guide other engineers with your technical domain knowledge

**Our wish list**

* 5+ years of full stack development experience, end to end development
* Being proactive and love picking up new things
* Able to find a good balance between quality and speed of development
* Able to collaborate and clearly communicate your ideas
* High sense of ownership
* Nice to haves:
	+ Typescript and/or Golang

**Benefits of working at Palm**

* Travel Meet all your new colleagues at quarterly off sites - the last 3 were in Lisbon, Amsterdam & Berlin.
* Coworking Membership Work from home is our go-to - we love spending time with friends and family instead of commuting. We have WeWork or Mindspace memberships for when you want to escape into the city.
* Stock Options Own a large chunk of Palm and reap the rewards as you help us grow the company to a global player.
* Pension ‍ Everything you need to not worry about life after work.
* Health Insurance Best-in-class local insurances to help you get treatment quickly whenever you may need it.
* Wellness Stipend 500 EUR in annual wellness benefits - gyms, massages, you name it.
* Time Off ️ 30 paid holidays for you to take time to recharge and relax.
* Homeoffice Stipend 500 EUR to upgrade your home office


Research shows that women and underrepresented groups only apply when they meet 100% of the criteria. We're not looking for perfection - if you're passionate about the role and have most of the skills, please apply!

title: Cloud Engineer
description:
Choosing Capgemini means choosing a company where you will be empowered to shape your career in the way you’d like, where you’ll be supported and inspired by a collaborative community of colleagues around the world, and where you’ll be able to reimagine what’s possible. Join us and help the world’s leading organizations unlock the value of technology and build a more sustainable, more inclusive world.
   

  

**OM ROLLEN**
 Vill du vara med och forma framtidens molnlösningar?
   

  

 Du blir en del av Capgeminis Cloud & Infrastructure Services (CIS)-enhet med fokus på projekt- och konsulttjänster i Norden. Vårt mål är att erbjuda kunder helhetslösningar inom Cloud med branschspecifik expertis, avancerad molnteknik och globala resurser. Vi erbjuder en mängd olika tjänster, från strategisk rådgivning till projektgenomförande.
   

  

 Syftet med rollen är att hjälpa kunder att ta till sig och nyttja den fulla potentialen i Public Cloud och du kommer att leda och arbeta i tvärfunktionella projekt. Du kommer att ingå i en community av likasinnade, skickliga cloud engineers och vara delaktig i att driva standardisering, policys och best practise för åtaganden inom Norden. I mindre team tillsammans med andra engineers från olika expertområden kommer du att bygga hållbara och pålitliga plattformstjänster. Du kommer att använda både open source-tekniker och leverantörsbaserade lösningar.
   

  

**DIN PROFIL**
 För att vara framgångsrik i rollen har du stor erfarenhet av att designa och implementera tekniska lösningar och verktyg i AWS, Azure eller GCP. Du bör vara van vid projekt- och konsultarbete och kunna engagera dig var som helst i projektets livscykel, från inledande kunddiskussioner enda fram till automatiserad leverans och hantering av plattformsmiljöer som utnyttjar DevOps.
   

  

 Vidare ser vi gärna:
   

  

* Praktisk erfarenhet av AWS-, Azure- och/eller GCP, helst med leverantörscertifieringar
* Erfarenhet av migrering, implementering av landningszoner och/eller Financial Operations (FinOps)
* Praktisk erfarenhet av Kubernetes och Docker Containers
* Praktisk erfarenhet av automation och orkestrering med verktyg som Packer, Terraform, Cloud Formation
* God kunskap inom cloud networking och lastbalansering
* Exponering och förståelse för automatiserad build pipeline, continous integration och continous deployment – samt erfarenhet av att implementera verktyg som stödjer dessa metoder
* Scripting-kunskaper i minst en av följande: Go, Ruby, Python
* Erfarenhet av Linux
* Kunskap om DevOps-koncept, aspekter och verktyg
* Dokumenterad erfarenhet av att leverera i agila miljöer
* God kommunikationsförmåga i svenska och engelska, både muntligt och skriftligt


 Capgemini is a global leader in partnering with companies to transform and manage their business by harnessing the power of technology. The Group is guided everyday by its purpose of unleashing human energy through technology for an inclusive and sustainable future. It is a responsible and diverse organization of nearly 350,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong 55-year heritage and deep industry expertise, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to address the entire breadth of their business needs, from strategy and design to operations, fueled by the fast evolving and innovative world of cloud, data, AI, connectivity, software, digital engineering and platforms. The Group reported 2022 global revenues of €22 billion. Get the Future You Want | www.capgemini.com
